title.narrative: Scaling Up Emergency WASH Support to Internally Displaced People (IDPs- New Arrivals) in Monguno and Jere LGAs of Borno State

description.narrative:
The proposed GREENCODE project is aimed at scaling up timely and equitable access to safe water through water trucking, sanitation, hygiene services and public health promotion activities and WASH NFIs, with a specialized provision hygiene kits that include menstrual hygiene products, particularly re-usable sanitary pads. The project is targeting to reach 15,300 IDPs (new arrivals) in both LGAs for water and hygiene promotion, while 500 women and girls will be targeted specially for menstrual hygiene management. People living with disability will be mainstreamed into both targets. The project objectives are i). To increase safe and equitable access to sufficient quantity of water for drinking, cooking and for personal/domestic hygiene purposes for both formal and informal camps hosting new arrivals (Fulatari, GSSSS and NRC site 1, 2 and new shelter) in Monguno LGA and IDP new settlements in Gongulong, Farm Center and Shuwari 8,opposite El-miskin camp in Jere LGAs. ii). To promote good hygiene practice (user friendly and gender appropriate kits) among the new arrivals in both formal and informal camps (Fulatari, GSSSS and NRC site 1, 2 and new shelter) in Monguno LGA and IDP new settlements in Gongulong, Farm Center and Shuwari 8,opposite El-miskin camp in Jere LGAs. In achieving this GREENCODE with the NHF grant will be trucking water daily to IDP locations (new arrivals) in Monguno and Jere, train and facilitate proper hygiene /health education activities using the two major language (Hausa and Kanuri), for proper understanding aimed at improved knowledge, attitude and practice of the people, GREENCODE will adopt the use of cartoons/pictorial messaging during the hygiene promotion sessions as tool for in promoting lifesaving behavioural change. Also, the project will provide specialised hygiene kits that include menstrual hygiene products particularly re-usable sanitary pads for women and girls of reproductive age. With regards to repairs of old sanitation facilities GREENCODE will work closely and have signed modalities with the original agencies that constructed them to enable/permit GREENCODE in repairing them, while land agreements will be reach with community members for the construction of new sanitation facilities in these locations.
GREENCODE has been responding to emergency humanitarian crisis in northeast for over 2 years now using the integrated multi-sector approach. Through the provision of life saving WASH activities, GREENCODE will contribute to mitigate the risk of cholera outbreak as the two LGAs has in recent past experienced outbreak of Cholera and this intervention will help checkmate future occurrence. Protection interventions will be mainstreamed into the project and maintain in all the project cycle. GREENCODE will adopt all-inclusive gender ratio of 60:30: 10 (women, men and youths) in the following activities, WASH committee, training, community Hygiene promoters, WASH kits distribution. Also, SGBV and child protection will be part of the training during WASH Committee and Hygiene promoters’ trainings. The hygiene/health promotion will be designed taking into account disposal of used menstrual hygiene products, accessible to children and the physically disabled, sex dis-aggregated. In mainstreaming the protection further, Staff of GREENCODE working on the project, WASH committee members and the leaders of the camps and IDPs locations within the LGAs will be trained on and informed about available referral pathways for confidential handling of SGBV and child abuse cases, in coordination with the GBV and CP sub-cluster and other actors. For the past 3 to 4 month the humanitarian situation in Mongonu, Jere and other LGAs in Borno is very dynamic and is rapidly changing and the new arrivals are in high need of humanitarian assistance, so GREENCODE project will be very flexible to reach the most vulnerable population among the new arrivals
